column2: [[1965]])  is a key figure of the [[Elvish Linguistic Fellowship]]. He is the author of numerous articles on [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]]ian linguistics
column3: and the editor of two journals on the subject
column4: [[Vinyar Tengwar]] (print) and [[Tengwestië]] (online). Hostetter has also contributed to various mailing-lists dedicated to Tolkien's languages
column5: including [[Tolklang]] and [[Elfling]]. After a (still ongoing) dispute with [[David Salo]] and [[Helge Fauskanger]]
column6: he set up [[Lambengolmor (mailing list)|Lambengolmor]] and [[Elfling-d]]. Together with [[Christopher Gilson]]
column9: and [[Patrick H. Wynne]] (called by some the "[[Elfconner]]s")
column10: he has been engaged by [[Christopher Tolkien]] in the ordering
column12: and publishing of [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s writings concerning his invented languages
column13: which have been published as ''[[Parma Eldalamberon]]'' numbers 11 through 22 (and continuing) and in ''Vinyar Tengwar''.

column4: and I'm not the chief editor of Tolkien's linguistic papers; I just do my part. Mostly
column5: I'm just the one tenacious/stupid enough to act as a human target for the team
column6: and for the fullness and reality of Tolkien's linguistic inventions.|Carl F. Hostetter
